alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 08 at 4:37PM CDT until July 08 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Cheyenne County in the panhandle of Nebraska... * Until 645 PM MDT. * At 337 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sidney, Lodgepole, Gurley, Colton, Sunol, Sidney Airport and Brownson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 48 and 77. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
